page.title: 01LERRYN, ST.VEEP AND GOLANT
page.content: This is a sparsely populated, rural area of outstanding natural beauty and is contained within the three parish boundaries of{St.Veep, {St.Winnow and St.Sampson. Most of the population live in the two small villages of{Golant}and {Lerryn,}the rest live on the farms and cottages scattered around the area. The main features of the area are the{river Fowey}and it's tributary the {Lerryn river}which are both tidal. The banks of the rivers are densely wooded with mainly decidious trees. The resident population consists of mainly retired people and those involved with farming. During the summer the number of visitors to the area, greatly increases the population.
